text: Roberta Fulton Fox (1943-2009) was a Florida attorney, politician, and feminist. She was born on November 25, 1943, and earned her law degree from the University of Florida, Fredric G. Levin College of Law. On June 10, 1968, Fox was admitted to the Florida State Bar. She practiced law with her husband Mike Gold. In addition to being an attorney, Fox served as a member of the Florida House of Representatives (1976-1982) and the Florida Senate (1982-1986). During her time in politics, she focused on issues such as family law reform—especially with regard to women’s and children’s rights. Fox died on August 9, 2009 after battling breast cancer. == References == Category:Florida lawyers Category:Members of the Florida House of Representatives Category:Florida state senators Category:University of Florida alumni Category:1943 births Category:2009 deaths Category:Women state legislators in Florida Category:20th-century American women lawyers
title: Roberta Fox
